intro: Mnesithea, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to various regions in Australia, particularly in the south-eastern and eastern parts of the country. The plants are characterized by their unique, often intricate floral structures that resemble spiders, giving them their common name. Mnesithea species typically grow as terrestrial herbs or small shrubs, with narrow leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. These plants are adapted to a range of environmental conditions, including sandy soils and rocky habitats.
